house.intro: Consciousness slowly returns to you after a very unnatural slumber. You feel your eyes open as panic sends your mind into an adrenaline fueled search of your last memory. You take deep breaths trying to calm yourself from the initial flood of panic. As your mind races you slowly come to terms that you have no recollection of the events that transpired before you woke. In fact, you fail to remember anything. Your eyes dart around the room in an attempt to find some kind of solution to the riddle of where and who you are.

room.name: unknown room
room.desc:
The room is completely foreign to you. There's no telling how long you've been unconscious. Days? Weeks?
 Months? You're uncertain. The only choice you have is to try to find answers. Try to find a way out. The
 truly unfortunate thing is that your capabilities are rendered. You only know how to look, open, and take
 the artifacts around you. The first thing you do is carefully inspect your surroundings.
 There's a bookshelf, the bed that you woke up on, a large metal door, and a desk.
room.l: You notice that the room is furnished with dusty antiques. The only light source is coming from thin paneled windows with bars on them. You take a moment to get more familiar with the room you're in.
room.o: You go to the metal door and try to escape. To no surprise, the metal door is locked. For a moment you contemplated the possibility of the windows being a way out. It's not long before you realize that even if you got the bars off, you wouldn't fit through the tiny slit anyway. Ultimately, your attempts to open the room have failed.
room.t: Knowing how to perform only three actions must be taking it's toll on your intelligence. After hours of struggling with your pockets you finally come to the conclusion that your pants were made too tight to fit a room inside of them. You give up, and stop trying to take the room.

item.history: <You found a history point! Score increased by 1.>
item.l: The desk is aged and brittle probably made out of wood. You're afraid to touch it in fear it might fall apart. Dust and thick spiderwebs are covering the surface. It must have been here for a long time to collect that much buildup. You start to fade away into a daydream, and for a moment everything goes black. When the light reappears, you notice you've drawn a symbol into the dust. You stare at it until the image is etched in your mind.
item.o: You hesitated for a moment because the thing feels unsteady. The last thing you want is for it to fall apart. Whoever has kept you here might be upset. Who DOES have you here, you wonder. Eventually you opened the drawers slowly as the desk trembled.
item.t: Your attempts are futile, poor thing. The second you got your arms around it the whole thing shifted and almost fell on top of you. You're lucky you're still alive.

requirement.prereq: <The journal is locked. You must find the key to unlock it.>

item.l: The journal is old, falling apart at its seams. You don't remember having seen this item before, but you're eyes are focused on the symbol engraved in the leather. It appears to be the as the one that appeared on the desk.
item.t: You take the journal hoping it will help lead to answers.

item.l: Your gaze focused in on the picture attached to the mirror on the desk. There's a man, a woman, and a little boy posing for a happy picture. Unfortunately, I don't know who the two boys are. At that moment my eyes shifted to the mirror and realized that the woman in the picture is me. YouI took a moment to inspect the picture further and found something strange on the back. There was a small note stuck to it that said, "keyword is SALT". As if you know what that means. This place, wherever it is, is eerie. This is not my home, why do they have a picture of me? Suddenly my urge to get out of has increased.

item.desc: The bed you woke up on.
item.l: You look at the filthy bed trying not to be sick.
item.o: The bed is covered in filth. Do not open it.
item.t: This disgusting bed is not worth taking along.

item.l: The chest contains your most precious things.
item.o: Hmm... I wonder what could be in the chest
item.t: The chest is too heavy to carry.

requirement.prereq: <You cannot get to that item at the moment.>

item.l: You look at the photo album, and blow off the dust build-up. Underneath all the dust, you see a beautiful leather cover with gold engravings.
item.o: You open the photo album and see old fashioned pictures of people you've never seen before.

requirement.prereq: <You must open the photo album first.>

You may need your flashlight to fend off monsters that live in darkness.
item.o: You open the flashlight to find two batteries and some wiring inside. They're dead of course.
item.t: Maybe the broken remains will come in handy.

item.o: You open the battery and nickel metal hydrate acid spills all over your hands.
item.t: You hesitantly decide to take the battery.

item.l: 'I feel sorry for anyone who has to lay their head on this pillow.'
item.o: You rip open the pillow and feathers fly everywhere getting stuck to everything damp. But within the dirty pile of feathers, you see something shining through. What could it be?
item.t: You grab the pillow. Maybe it will be of some use later.

item.l: I have never seen anything like this before. I wonder what it could be used for.
item.o: You twist the prism every which way, but you cannot get it to open. Then, you find a small hole on one of the sides. Maybe there's a key or special device that will open it.
item.t: 'I'd better hold onto this in case I need it later.'

item.l: 'I keep the key to my chest under here when I'm not holding it.'
item.t: You try to take the mattress off the bed, but fail miserably. You ripped it open!
item.o: Under the mattress you find an key.

item.l: I don't know what it opens, but it's got to open something.
item.t: You hold on to the key hoping it will be valuable.

requirement.prereq: <You desperately wiggle the knob, but the door does not open. You must find the item(s) needed to open.>

item.l: I think this is probably the way out of the room. The light shining through allows me to see the shape of other objects around.
